author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
At least five Maoists were killed in an encounter with the elite troops of the Central Reserve Police Force in a forest area of Bihar’s Naxal-affected Aurangabad district on Friday. Arms and ammunition were seized from the encounter site.

Police officials said some Maoists were injured in the gun battle between the CRPF and the ultras.

“The encounter started late in the evening in the Dibhara area of Aurangabad district. Five bodies of the Maoists were recovered,” police said. An AK series assault rifle, one carbine, a country-made gun and some other ammunition were recovered.
title: 5 Maoists die in Bihar encounter
